title: Should I switch to "checkpint sync" now?
body:
My node has been syncing for a while now(8 days), and here's the latest log:
CL:
```
time="2023-09-01 14:54:37" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0xe8c18e0af93a prefix=blockchain slot=6232378
time="2023-09-01 14:54:37" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0x26dc03d219f1 prefix=blockchain slot=6232379
time="2023-09-01 14:54:37" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0x72f1ddbe714e prefix=blockchain slot=6232380
time="2023-09-01 14:54:37" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0x2b8d9858bb44 prefix=blockchain slot=6232381
time="2023-09-01 14:54:37" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0x768649bc5352 prefix=blockchain slot=6232382
time="2023-09-01 14:54:37" level=info msg="Called new payload with optimistic block" payloadBlockHash=0x6c5d773eec08 prefix=blockchain slot=6232383
time="2023-09-01 14:54:37" level=info msg="Called fork choice updated with optimistic block" finalizedPayloadBlockHash=0x9765c1402bd5 headPayloadBlockHash=0x6c5d773eec08 headSlot=6232383 prefix=blockchain
time="2023-09-01 14:54:37" level=info msg="Processing block batch of size 58 starting from  0x7334f1cd... 6232384/7227271 - estimated time remaining 30h2m19s" blocksPerSecond=9.2 peers=35 prefix=initial-sync
```

EL:
```
INFO [09-01|14:55:37.676] Syncing: chain download in progress      synced=100.00% chain=327.56GiB headers=17,056,775@6.60GiB bodies=17,056,677@215.96GiB receipts=17,056,677@105.00GiB eta=29.202s
WARN [09-01|14:55:37.945] Pivot seemingly stale, moving            old=17,056,678 new=17,056,741
INFO [09-01|14:55:38.745] Syncing: state healing in progress       accounts=0@0.00B slots=0@0.00B codes=34716@259.11MiB nodes=97,790,751@7.55GiB pending=1
INFO [09-01|14:55:44.472] Forkchoice requested sync to new head    number=17,056,869 hash=13e9c5..e116e4 finalized=17,056,806
INFO [09-01|14:55:45.750] Syncing: chain download in progress      synced=100.00% chain=327.56GiB headers=17,056,838@6.60GiB bodies=17,056,740@215.96GiB receipts=17,056,740@105.00GiB eta=29.395s
WARN [09-01|14:55:46.948] Pivot seemingly stale, moving            old=17,056,741 new=17,056,805
INFO [09-01|14:55:47.819] Syncing: state healing in progress       accounts=0@0.00B slots=0@0.00B codes=34716@259.11MiB nodes=97,790,751@7.55GiB pending=1
```
eth.syncing:
```
{
  currentBlock: 17057747,
  healedBytecodeBytes: 271694812,
  healedBytecodes: 34716,
  healedTrienodeBytes: 8106227747,
  healedTrienodes: 97790751,
  healingBytecode: 0,
  healingTrienodes: 0,
  highestBlock: 17057812,
  startingBlock: 17033083,
  syncedAccountBytes: 47670286424,
  syncedAccounts: 192520528,
  syncedBytecodeBytes: 5057491353,
  syncedBytecodes: 763178,
  syncedStorage: 831341321,
  syncedStorageBytes: 178645236259
}
```
 Now I'm considering about whether I should switch to the checkpoint method of syncing, and I have two questions: 

1, if I switch to the checkpoint method now, do I need to clear the data and start syncing over? 
2, I'm not sure how much longer the current sync method will take, if I switch to checkpoint now, will I be able to finish the sync in a shorter period of time?
 Thanks a lot!
